text: I needed a photo of some yeast cells
preferably yeast cells reproducing so I
got some bread makers yeast from the
supermarket and mixed it with water and
sugar and a beaker and set the whole
thing up on the hot plate just at about
90 degrees F and after a few minutes it
was all frothy producing carbon dioxide
as used cells are likely to do and so I
poured the mixture into a couple test
tubes and put them in the centrifuge and
ran it for just a minute just to
concentrate the cells at the bottom of
the test tube and then I scraped the
cells out of the test tube and put them
on a slide with the coverslip
and put them under the microscope so I'm
not sure the exact magnification it
probably better just to look up the size
of breadmakers yeast cells on the
internet and use that as a reference
rather than try to figure out the
magnification the objective is 40 X but
you have to take into account the
distance between the objective and the
camera since I'm not using an IPS to
show this video so I'm not really sure
if the yeast cells are actually
reproducing in this video you can see
the cells moving around but I think this
effect is actually just caused by the
bubbles the air and the water moving
under the coverslip anyway I thought it
was pretty neat okay see you next time
bye
